intro: Caucalis gingidium, commonly known as the Caucasian thimbleweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a taproot system and can reach a height of up to 30 centimeters. Caucalis gingidium is native to regions of Europe and Asia, including parts of the Caucasus, and is often found in temperate climates.
